question_text: Why might a newer AMD CPU be incompatible with an older AM4 motherboard even if the socket type matches?
answer_options: AM4 sockets only support DDR4 memory
AM4 sockets have a limited lifespan
BIOS firmware may not support newer CPUs
The CPU pins are too short for older boards
correct_answer: BIOS firmware may not support newer CPUs
explanation: Even if the socket type matches, a motherboard may require a BIOS update to support newer CPU models.
